title: Factors influencing shares price during the covid-19 period. An evidence from hospitality and tourism industry companies listed in Indonesia stock exchange
abstract: This research paper intends so study the factors influencing shares price during the COVID-19 period, especially in companies listed in Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) that works in hospitality and tourism industry business sectors. This research will be conducted based on 30 sample companies that have been listed in Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) during the period of 2017-2021. The factors studied in this research are related to Earning Per Share (EPS), sales growth (SG), Price Book Value (PBV), Debt-to-Equity Ratio (DER), Return on Assets (ROA) and COVID-19 Period. All of these factors mentioned in the previous sentence will be set as the independent variables, in which their significancy will be tested towards one dependent variable, namely share price. Overall, there are a total of six hypotheses which shall be tested in this research. Hypothesis testing will be carried out with the help of GRETL statistical software using the Weighted Least Square (WLS) model. The result from analysis has concluded that two out of six hypotheses being tested can be accepted. Keywords: Shares price, COVID-19, Hospitality and Tourism Industry, Indonesia Stock Exchange
contributors: Josua Tarigan (Advisor and Examination Committee); Saarce Elsye Hatane (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 32011785/AKT/2022; Adeline Nathania Cheng (D12180144)
